thread.title: The Nokia 3310 might come back and people just really want to play Snake
thread.title_full: The Nokia 3310 might come back and people just really want to play Snake

author: Gianluca Mezzofiore
title: The Nokia 3310 might come back and people just really want to play Snake
text:
The Nokia 3310 might come back and people just really want to play Snake 0 By Gianluca Mezzofiore 2017-02-15 10:22:17 UTC 
We live in the era of nostalgia after all, as confirmed by the triumph of retro TV shows, movies and games such as Stranger Things , La La Land and Pokémon Go . 
So when a reliable report on VentureBeat hinted at the return of the beloved Nokia 3310, a nearly indestructible phone whose battery seemed to last forever, people on Twitter reacted with justifiable excitement: Nokia 3310 reborn? My son would be sorely tempted to trade in his iPhone. https://t.co/g6jplGWhh8 pic.twitter.com/RcVBrR2NWu 
— mala bhargava (@malabhargava) February 15, 2017 Am here for the nokia 3310 as my 3rd phone. Will carry them all at once😂😂 
— Bad Presidential❤ (@Audrianna011) February 15, 2017 
Details on the alleged re-release are scarce. 
The HMD Global Oy, the Finnish manufacturer that bought the rights to market phones under the Nokia brand from Microsoft, will reportedly launch a "modern version" of 3310 at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona this month. According to the report, the phone will be launched on Feb. 26 and will cost only €59 ($63). 
However, the burning question: will the new 3310 contain the legendary Snake game? Twitter certainly hopes so: I'll buy the Nokia 3310 just for the Snake game 
— Samiya Daud (@thamiyah) February 15, 2017 @AlexisYoungxox how is that old nokia 3310 going? 😂😂😂 pic.twitter.com/pOQWsefMX4 
— 🥃🍸Mr L🍸🥃 (@toyburu2) February 15, 2017 The Nokia 3310 is coming back! Hands down my favourite phone of my formative years #longlivesnake 🐍 https://t.co/lv756rQtOB pic.twitter.com/rdI2dzk5Dn 
— Victoria Woollaston (@vickywoollaston) February 15, 2017 Apparently The Nokia 3310 being re-release! Endless hours of snake back 😂👌🏻 pic.twitter.com/bEPFJVIs64 
— Alice Warwick (@Warwick96) February 15, 2017 Are they seriously re-releasing the Nokia 3310?! All the nostalgia 😂🐍 #snake pic.twitter.com/5ItW9iYSEr 
— Luke Baker 🖖 (@Buke_Laker) February 15, 2017 If they're going to re make the Nokia 3310 they can't leave out Snake, that game was used more than I used the phone to text or call anyone.
